Description: Fragment of foot and lower wall of Terra Sigillata pottery bowl; slightly flaring ring foot; slight offset at top of wall as preserved. Stamp "XANTHI" in centre of floor.
Curator's comments: Roman Pottery For Xanthus, an Arretine potter, cf. BM Vase L169; C.I.L., xi. 6700, 835, and Bonner Jahrb., ci. p. 25.
Bibliographic references: Roman Pottery / Catalogue of the Roman Pottery in the British Museum (L42)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.004)
